item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Thursday, May 1, 2025 at 3:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Vanguard 50-year anniversary CEO letter (77 points | 39 comments)
2. A faster way to copy SQLite databases between computers (202 points | 100 comments)
3. Are You the Same Person You Used to Be? (14 points | 8 comments)
4. Linkwarden: FOSS self-hostable bookmarking with AI-tagging and page archival (66 points | 30 comments)
5. Judge Rules Apple Executive Lied Under Oath, Makes Criminal Contempt Referral (294 points | 87 comments)
6. Trust Me, I'm Local: Chrome Extensions, MCP, and the Sandbox Escape (55 points | 16 comments)
7. We identified a North Korean hacker who tried to get a job at Kraken (6 points | 1 comment)
8. How to vibe code for free: Running Qwen3 on your Mac, using MLX (117 points | 79 comments)
9. Office is too slow, so Microsoft is making it load at Windows startup (471 points | 637 comments)
10. 108B Pixel Scan of Johannes Vermeer's Girl with a Pearl Earring (375 points | 110 comments)
11. International Workers' Day (136 points | 26 comments)
12. Show HN: Hyperparam: OSS Tools for Exploring Datasets Locally in the Browser (14 points | 11 comments)
13. Mercury: Commercial-scale diffusion language model (357 points | 149 comments)
14. In the US, not even $11,000 a month can buy you dignity at the end of your life (6 points | discuss)
15. Apple violated antitrust ruling, judge finds (951 points | 429 comments)
16. The one interview question that will protect you from North Korean fake workers (130 points | 93 comments)
17. The Brief Origins of May Day (131 points | 147 comments)
18. Pwning the Ladybird Browser (267 points | 43 comments)
19. Two publishers and three authors fail to understand what "vibe coding" means (17 points | 9 comments)
20. Espressif's ESP32-C5 Is Now in Mass Production (222 points | 153 comments)
21. How the US defense secretary circumvents official DoD communications equipment (332 points | 295 comments)
22. All four major web browsers are about to lose 80% of their funding (497 points | 500 comments)
23. Linux Kernel Exploitation: Attack of the Vsock (218 points | 63 comments)
24. All roses were once yellow (7 points | discuss)
25. NASA's Psyche spacecraft hits a speed bump on the way to a metal asteroid (19 points | discuss)
26. If you're in the market for a $1,900 color E Ink monitor, one of them exists now (33 points | 26 comments)
27. Zhaoxin's KX-7000 (169 points | 45 comments)
28. Xiaomi MiMo Reasoning Model (463 points | 178 comments)
29. I created Perfect Wiki and reached $250k in annual revenue without investors (666 points | 376 comments)
30. The term "vegetative electron microscopy" keeps showing up in scientific papers (3 points | discuss)
item.guid: Hacker News Top Stories: Thursday, May 1, 2025 at 3:15 PM UTC
